update.description:
Addresses Issue #143.
(Merged pull request #370).

See documentation on [RoadMap](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Roadmap).

Needs testing.

To test:
~~~
mkdir catkin_ws
mkdir catkin_ws/src
cd catkin_ws/src
hg clone #!/osrf/osrf-common -r catkin
hg clone #!/osrf/sandia-hand -r catkin
hg clone #!/osrf/drcsim -r catkin
git clone -b groovy-devel https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs.git
~~~

For example, `ls catkin_ws/src` should show 4 repositories:
~~~
osrf-common
sandia-hand
drcsim
gazebo_ros_pkgs
~~~

To build:
Assuming all system and ROS dependencies have been installed:
~~~
cd catkin_ws
source /opt/ros/groovy/setup.bash
catkin_make install
~~~
should do the job.  To run something, try:
~~~
cd catkin_ws/install
source setup.sh
source share/drcsim/setup.sh
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_sandia_hands.launch
~~~


John

content.html:
@nkoenig helped me get it to build by:

  • installing ros-hydro-cmake-modules ,

  • and also changing an include file in gazebo_ros_pkgs ./gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_projector.cpp. Changed from <gazebo/rendering/Rendering.hh> to <gazebo/rendering/RenderingIface.hh>

pullrequest.title: catkinize drcsim with new atlas model (catkin drcsim 3.1.0 candidate)

content.raw: The original way of duplication required some modification, e.g. comment out any functionality and references to `gazebo_msgs`.  Also, include path for some headers had to be changed.  A cleaner way to duplicate code now that everything is catkinized, we can simply copy the entire groovy-devel source as-is into drcsim repo?
content.html: The original way of duplication required some modification, e.g. comment out any functionality and references to gazebo_msgs. Also, include path for some headers had to be changed. A cleaner way to duplicate code now that everything is catkinized, we can simply copy the entire groovy-devel source as-is into drcsim repo?

pullrequest.title: catkinize drcsim with new atlas model (catkin drcsim 3.1.0 candidate)

content.raw:
What's the release plan for this change on Precise, where we use Groovy?  Hosting our own version of some ROS debs sounds worse to me than just keeping the duplicate code inside drcsim until we drop support for Groovy.

And as a developer, I'd much prefer to have drcsim build against Groovy as is, without needing to pull some ROS stuff from source.
content.html:
What's the release plan for this change on Precise, where we use Groovy? Hosting our own version of some ROS debs sounds worse to me than just keeping the duplicate code inside drcsim until we drop support for Groovy.

And as a developer, I'd much prefer to have drcsim build against Groovy as is, without needing to pull some ROS stuff from source.

update.description:
Addresses Issue #143.

See documentation on [RoadMap](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Roadmap).

Needs testing.

To test:
~~~
mkdir catkin_ws
mkdir catkin_ws/src
cd catkin_ws/src
[ checkout/link to osrf-common sources here]
[ checkout/link to sandia-hand sources here]
[ checkout/link to drcsim sources here]
[checkout gazebo_ros_pkgs somewhere else, but copy/soft link to gazebo_msgs, gazebo_ros and gazebo_plugins here]
~~~

For example, `ls catkin_ws/src` should show 3 repositories + 3 packages:
~~~
osrf-common
sandia-hand
drcsim
gazebo_plugins
gazebo_ros
gazebo_msgs
~~~

To build:
Assuming all system and ROS dependencies have been installed:
~~~
cd catkin_ws
source /opt/ros/hydro/setup.bash
catkin_make install
~~~
should do the job.  To run something, try:
~~~
cd catkin_ws/install
source setup.sh
source share/drcsim/setup.sh
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_sandia_hands.launch
~~~


John

content.raw: In  7ecd9362af8e I added a minimal CMakeLists.txt at the root directory to allow people to use the familiar cmake workflow without creating a symlink to catkin's `toplevel.cmake`.
content.html: In 7ecd9362af8e I added a minimal CMakeLists.txt at the root directory to allow people to use the familiar cmake workflow without creating a symlink to catkin's toplevel.cmake.

pull_request.title: catkinize drcsim with new atlas model (catkin drcsim 3.1.0 candidate)

update.description:
Addresses Issue #143.

See documentation on [RoadMap](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Roadmap).

Needs testing.

To test:
~~~
mkdir catkin_ws
mkdir catkin_ws/src
cd catkin_ws/src
[ checkout/link to osrf-common sources here]
[ checkout/link to sandia-hand sources here]
[ checkout/link to drcsim sources here]
~~~

For example, `ls catkin_ws/src` should show 3 repositories:
~~~
osrf-common
sandia-hand
drcsim
~~~

To build:
Assuming all system and ROS dependencies have been installed:
~~~
cd catkin_ws
source /opt/ros/hydro/setup.bash
catkin_make install
~~~
should do the job.  To run something, try:
~~~
cd catkin_ws/install
source setup.sh
source share/drcsim/setup.sh
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_sandia_hands.launch
~~~


John
update.title: catkinize drcsim

pullrequest.title: catkinize drcsim with new atlas model (catkin drcsim 3.1.0 candidate)

content.raw:
I was confused by this output during the configure:

~~~
CMake Warning at drcsim_model_resources/CMakeLists.txt:87 (find_package):
  Could not find module Findosrf-common.cmake or a configuration file for
  package osrf-common.

  Adjust CMAKE_MODULE_PATH to find Findosrf-common.cmake or set
  osrf-common_DIR to the directory containing a CMake configuration file for
  osrf-common.  The file will have one of the following names:

    osrf-commonConfig.cmake
    osrf-common-config.cmake



-- osrf-common not found, not building atlas with joint controllers.
CMake Warning at drcsim_model_resources/CMakeLists.txt:97 (find_package):
  Could not find module Findsandia-hand.cmake or a configuration file for
  package sandia-hand.

  Adjust CMAKE_MODULE_PATH to find Findsandia-hand.cmake or set
  sandia-hand_DIR to the directory containing a CMake configuration file for
  sandia-hand.  The file will have one of the following names:

    sandia-handConfig.cmake
    sandia-hand-config.cmake



-- sandia-hand not found, not building atlas with sandia hand
~~~

Looking at the code: [here](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/2593e4a653c459b10dc9a983e39798b982265768/drcsim_model_resources/CMakeLists.txt?at=catkin#cl-86) and [here](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/2593e4a653c459b10dc9a983e39798b982265768/drcsim_model_resources/CMakeLists.txt?at=catkin#cl-96), it seems that those checks don't actually go anywhere (i.e., nobody consults `HAVE_OSRF_COMMON` or `HAVE_SANDIA_HAND`). Can that code be removed?
content.html:
I was confused by this output during the configure:

CMake Warning at drcsim_model_resources/CMakeLists.txt:87 (find_package):
  Could not find module Findosrf-common.cmake or a configuration file for
  package osrf-common.

  Adjust CMAKE_MODULE_PATH to find Findosrf-common.cmake or set
  osrf-common_DIR to the directory containing a CMake configuration file for
  osrf-common.  The file will have one of the following names:

    osrf-commonConfig.cmake
    osrf-common-config.cmake



-- osrf-common not found, not building atlas with joint controllers.
CMake Warning at drcsim_model_resources/CMakeLists.txt:97 (find_package):
  Could not find module Findsandia-hand.cmake or a configuration file for
  package sandia-hand.

  Adjust CMAKE_MODULE_PATH to find Findsandia-hand.cmake or set
  sandia-hand_DIR to the directory containing a CMake configuration file for
  sandia-hand.  The file will have one of the following names:

    sandia-handConfig.cmake
    sandia-hand-config.cmake



-- sandia-hand not found, not building atlas with sandia hand

Looking at the code: here and here, it seems that those checks don't actually go anywhere (i.e., nobody consults HAVE_OSRF_COMMON or HAVE_SANDIA_HAND). Can that code be removed?

content.raw: you can test build [catkin_gazebo_ros_pkgs branch](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/806a594468b6d8d83535cbcbbe467607eb59cbe1/?at=catkin_gazebo_ros_pkgs).  All you need to do is add `gazebo_plugins`, `gazebo_ros` and `gazebo_msgs` from `gazebo_ros_pkgs` to the catkin workspace and it should compile.
content.html: you can test build catkin_gazebo_ros_pkgs branch. All you need to do is add gazebo_plugins, gazebo_ros and gazebo_msgs from gazebo_ros_pkgs to the catkin workspace and it should compile.

pull_request.title: catkinize drcsim with new atlas model (catkin drcsim 3.1.0 candidate)

pullrequest.title: catkinize drcsim with new atlas model (catkin drcsim 3.1.0 candidate)

content.raw: It would be nice to remove our forked copy of gazebo_plugins from gazebo_ros_pkgs. As John mentioned in the [RoadMap](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Roadmap), this is easy to do on hydro, but not so easy for groovy, since gazebo_ros_pkgs wasn't released into groovy. One option is for us to build and host groovy debs of the packages from gazebo_ros_pkgs that we need, and make them conflict with ros-groovy-simulator-gazebo.
content.html: It would be nice to remove our forked copy of gazebo_plugins from gazebo_ros_pkgs. As John mentioned in the RoadMap, this is easy to do on hydro, but not so easy for groovy, since gazebo_ros_pkgs wasn't released into groovy. One option is for us to build and host groovy debs of the packages from gazebo_ros_pkgs that we need, and make them conflict with ros-groovy-simulator-gazebo.
